titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1574b
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1574b

encodingDesc.p: The original encoding was done in plain text files following the encoding quidelines of the Morgenländische Gesellschaft. With a dedicated web application these plain text files were transformed into XML documents validating (partially) against the Epidoc-Schema and those XML-Documents have been further sematically annotaded.
In order to avoid well known xml-issues especially in regards of overlapping elements the actual edited/annotated text was multiplied in several anonymos blocks, each block providing specific markup.

Text preserved in this squeeze:
[... ... ... ... ... ...]
Restored text of this inscription:
1.[… Saʾdum M.fakān and their son ʾA-] 2.[bīkarib have dedicated to ʾĪlmuquhū Lord of] 3.[the Ibexes of Ṣirwāḥ a statue of bronze, as] 4.[he had granted him proprietorial rights with respect to Thawabtha-] 5.[wān bin Murādum, client of the lineage of] 6.[Dhū-Ḥibāb, in accordance with the legal case and the proclamation] 7.[which they had initiated and proclaimed for his son] 8.[ʾAbīkarib when ʿAbdʿathtar had demanded from him] 9.[an obligation involving a contract. And verily ʾĪlmuquh granted] 10.[that he restore to ʾAbīkarib] 11.[the proprietorial rights. And verily they praised the power and might of] 12.[ʾĪlmuquh when he restored to his servants their proprietorial rights,] 13.[as he had declared to them his will through] 14.[an oracle that he would vouchsafe deliverance] 15.[from it, inasmuch as he cannot avoid] 16.[imploring him and seeking oracles from him] 17.[regarding whatever claims might be contested. And verily] 18.[his lord ʾĪlmuquhū promised him] 19.[the deliverance of his servants from his wrath.] 20.[And verily Sharaḥʿathat] 21.[and ʾAbīkarib have dedicated to their master ʾĪlmuquhū] 22.[(this) statue for the well-being of their persons] 23.[and their cattle. By ʾĪlmuquhū and] 24.[their tutelary deity!]

Text preserved in this squeeze:
Restored text of this inscription:
… Saʾdum M.fakān and their son ʾA-
bīkarib have dedicated to ʾĪlmuquhū Lord of
the Ibexes of Ṣirwāḥ a statue of bronze, as
he had granted him proprietorial rights with respect to Thawabtha-
wān bin Murādum, client of the lineage of
Dhū-Ḥibāb, in accordance with the legal case and the proclamation
which they had initiated and proclaimed for his son
ʾAbīkarib when ʿAbdʿathtar had demanded from him
an obligation involving a contract. And verily ʾĪlmuquh granted
that he restore to ʾAbīkarib
the proprietorial rights. And verily they praised the power and might of
ʾĪlmuquh when he restored to his servants their proprietorial rights,
as he had declared to them his will through
an oracle that he would vouchsafe deliverance
from it, inasmuch as he cannot avoid
imploring him and seeking oracles from him
regarding whatever claims might be contested. And verily
his lord ʾĪlmuquhū promised him
the deliverance of his servants from his wrath.
And verily Sharaḥʿathat
and ʾAbīkarib have dedicated to their master ʾĪlmuquhū
this statue for the well-being of their persons
and their cattle. By ʾĪlmuquhū and
their tutelary deity!

Text preserved in this squeeze:
Restored text of this inscription:

bīkarib have dedicated to ʾĪlmuquhū Lord of
the Ibexes of Ṣirwāḥ a statue of bronze, as

ʾAbīkarib when ʿAbdʿathtar had demanded from him
an obligation involving a contract. And verily ʾĪlmuquh granted
that he restore to ʾAbīkarib

ʾĪlmuquh when he restored to his servants their proprietorial rights,
as he had declared to them his will through
an oracle that he would vouchsafe deliverance
from it, inasmuch as he cannot avoid
imploring him and seeking oracles from him
regarding whatever claims might be contested. And verily
his lord ʾĪlmuquhū promised him
the deliverance of his servants from his wrath.
And verily Sharaḥʿathat
and ʾAbīkarib have dedicated to their master ʾĪlmuquhū
this statue for the well-being of their persons
and their cattle. By ʾĪlmuquhū and
their tutelary deity!
